answers.answer: It sounds like you have light sensitivity and you are seeing squiggles in your right eye when the background is bright.  This is a good set of symptoms to take to an opthamologist for a thorough eye exam. It could be just an issue with your eyes, or it could be from an underlying issue that can cause vision problems (diabetes, for example).

question: At age 62, I have recently become aware that I can see ( along with my numerous other visual disturbances)blood vessels in my right eye when squinting or looking at white lighted surfaces.  Is there a name for this and what is the cause?  Also, no one has been able to tell me why I have for many years had a shimmering in bright light when not wearing sunglasses.  Thank you for your time.
title: not a medical professional
